Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rabbi Diana S. Gerson, New York Board of Rabbis, Program Director, 136 East 39th Street, New York, NY 10016.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Levine.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rabbi Diana S. Gerson, New York Board of Rabbis, Program Director, 136 East 39th Street, New York, NY 10016.

On behalf of Council Member Garodnick, Council Member Levine moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of February 26, 2014 be adopted as printed by Council Member King.
Items.MinutesNote: On behalf of Council Member King, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of February 26, 2014 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Mendez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 109 Avenue A, in the Borough of Manhattan, Community District 3, Application no. 20145305 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 109 Avenue A, Manhattan (20145305 TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Mendez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 32 Avenue B, in the Borough of Manhattan, Community District 3, Application no. 20145306 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 32 Avenue B, Manhattan (20145306 TCM)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Greenfield:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application no. C 130339 ZSM shall be subject to Council review.  These items are related to Application nos. C 130336 ZMM and C 130337 ZRM which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 606 West 57th Street, Manhattan (C130336 ZMM)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the allowable maximum heat loss through building walls.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Allowable maximum heat loss through building walls.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the permitting and monitoring of portable generators.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Permitting and monitoring of portable generators.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the noise standard for commercial establishments.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Noise standard for commercial establishments.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the administration for children's services to provide an annual report regarding high school graduation rates of youth in foster care.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring the administration for children's services to provide information regarding high school graduation rates of youth in foster care.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of youth and community development to review strategies and create a plan of action to protect children who qualify for special immigrant juvenile status.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MatterName: Review strategies and create a plan of action to protect children who qualify for special immigrant juvenile status.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of sanitation to collect and report data related to the unlawful posting of printed material.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of sanitation to collect and report data related to the unlawful posting of printed material.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to providing assistance to seniors with bed bugs in their homes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Providing assistance to seniors with bed bugs in their homes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing the minimum distance at which a vehicle can park adjacent to a fire hydrant.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Reducing the minimum distance at which a vehicle can park adjacent to a fire hydrant.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation which designates as professional misconduct, engaging in sexual orientation change efforts by mental health care professionals upon patients under 18 years of age.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Designates as professional misconduct, engaging in sexual orientation change efforts by mental health care professionals upon patients under 18 years of age.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Assembly to pass and the Governor to sign the Michael Sandy Act, which limits the admissibility of evidence of a defendant and victim falling under the same protected category in hate crime cases.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Michael Sandy Act

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Capital One to amend their individual credit card agreements regarding how and when they contact cardholders for debt collection.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Capital One to amend their individual credit card agreements regarding how and when they contact cardholders for debt collection.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city New York, in relation to requiring the department of environmental protection to notify water customers who are owners of tax class two properties, by mail, of large charges that could indicate a potential leak.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of environmental protection to notify water customers who are owners of tax class 2 properties, by mail, of large charges that could indicate a potential leak.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the district plan of the Church Avenue business improvement district to authorize additional services and modify existing services for the district.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Church Avenue BID

Items.Title: A Local Law To amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the district plan of the Downtown-Lower Manhattan business improvement district to change the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Downtown-Lower Manhattan BID

Items.Title: A Local Law To amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the district plan of the Kings Highway business improvement district to authorize additional services and modify existing services for the district.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Kings Highway BID

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning an amendment to the District Plan of the Church Avenue Business Improvement District that authorizes additional services and modifies existing services for the district, and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing of the local law authorizing additional services and modifying existing services for the district.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Church Avenue BID

Items.Title: Resolution concerning an amendment to the District Plan of the Downtown-Lower Manhattan Business Improvement District that provides for a change in the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based, and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing of the local law authorizing a change in the method of assessment upon which the district charge in the Downtown-Lower Manhattan Business Improvement District is based.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Downtown-Lower Manhattan BID

Items.Title: Resolution concerning an amendment to the District Plan of the Kings Highway Business Improvement District that authorizes additional services and modifies existing services for the district, and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing of the local law authorizing additional services and modifying existing services for the district.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Kings Highway BID

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing community boards to determine whether parking meter regulations are in effect on Saturday and/or Sunday.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Allowing community boards to determine whether parking meter regulations are in effect on Saturday and/or Sunday.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to side guards
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Side Guards

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to retaliatory personnel actions by employers and wage transparency.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Retaliatory personnel actions by employers and wage transparency.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Assembly to pass A.3941-A, the New York State Senate to introduce and pass a companion bill, and the Governor to sign such legislation into law, which would create the Children’s Weapon Accident Prevention Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Create the Children’s Weapon Accident Prevention Act. (A.3941-A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the reuse or recycling of discarded carpeting from commercial units or buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Reuse or recycling of discarded carpeting from commercial units or buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to community board notification prior to installing or removing traffic calming devices or installing traffic control signals or devices.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Community board notification prior to installing or removing traffic calming devices or installing traffic control signals or devices.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to free parking during nighttime hours.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Free parking during nighttime hours.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to public access stairways.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Public access stairways.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, the New York city building code and the New York city fire code, in relation to hold-open devices and automatic closing of exit doors serving vertical exit enclosures.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Hold-open devices and automatic closing of exit doors serving vertical exit enclosures.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation prohibiting buses from using streets adjacent to houses of worship or schools for the purposes of layovers, staging, or idling.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting buses from using streets adjacent to houses of worship or schools for the purposes of layovers, staging, or idling.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing fines for the depositing of residential or commercial refuse into public litter baskets.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Increasing fines for the depositing of residential or commercial refuse into public litter baskets.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to the creation of a safe patient handling advisory board.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Creation of a safe patient handling advisory board.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that all hotels in the city of New York provide their housekeeping staff with silent alarms for their protection.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring that all hotels in the NYC provide their housekeeping staff with silent alarms for their protection.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to enacting the Diplomatic Immunity Notification Act.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Enacting the Diplomatic Immunity Notification Act.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to enacting the Child Protection Notification Act.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Enacting the Child Protection Notification Act.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing the use of carryout bags
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Plastic Bag Bill - Reducing the use of carryout bags.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring the compilation of bike share usage data.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of transportation to make available on its website biographical information pertaining to all street and park name changes.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Providing legal services for tenants who are subject to eviction proceedings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.5723-A/S.3995-A, legislation that would ensure that consumers have the option to access every covered medication from a local network participating pharmacy, including HIV/AIDS medications, and are not forced into mandatory mail order.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Ensure that consumers have the option to access every covered medication from a local network participating pharmacy, including HIV/AIDS medications. (A.5723-A/S.3995-A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to make automated external defibrillators available to primary, intermediate and high schools that do not already receive such devices under any other provision of law.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to make automated external defibrillators available to primary, intermediate and high schools.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the annual repair of street defects.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation

Items.MatterName: Providing legal counsel for parents and guardians with minor children who are subject to eviction, ejectment or foreclosure proceedings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City charter, in relation to the creation of an annual report to assess the city’s indigent legal representation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Creation of an annual report to assess the city’s indigent legal representation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of buildings to conduct structural inspections of those multiple dwellings that have a dangerous number of hazardous or immediately hazardous violations and the department of housing preservation and development to correct structural defects when the owner fails to do so.

Items.MatterName: Structural Inspection, Multiple Dwellings

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the obligations of owners to provide notice to their tenants for service interruptions
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a bicycle safety task force.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Increase the penalties for leaving the scene of a motor vehicle incident without reporting. (S.2503/A.1533)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign a comprehensive immigration reform bill that does not include any provisions that would further deny Social Security benefits to undocumented immigrants.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Vehicle idling restrictions.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation that would make a violation of Hayley and Diego’s Law a misdemeanor.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Make a violation of Hayley and Diego’s Law a misdemeanor.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to introduce and pass and the Governor to sign a law, which would allow the City of New York to use Design-Build contracts for construction projects.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Allow the City of New York to use Design-Build contracts for construction projects.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to veteran identification cards.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Veteran identification cards.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.6570/A.8742, requiring all textbooks to also refer to the Sea of Japan as the East Sea.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring all textbooks to also refer to the Sea of Japan as the East Sea. (S.6570/A.8742)

Items.Title: Resolution in support of A.8587/S.6386, which would amend the New York State Penal Law by increasing the penalties for drivers who cause serious physical injury or death to another person while knowingly operating a motor vehicle without a license or with a revoked or suspended license.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Increasing the penalties for drivers who cause serious physical injury or death to another person while knowingly operating a motor vehicle without a license or with a revoked or suspended license. (A.8587/S.6386)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring all children with an individualized education program to be transported in buses with air-conditioning.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring all children with an individualized education program to be transported in buses with air-conditioning.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to an invasive species advisory board.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: An invasive species advisory board.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to renaming two thoroughfares and public places in the Borough of Queens, Court Square East and Court Square West, and to amend the official map of the city of New York accordingly.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Renaming two thoroughfares and public places, Queens, Court Square East and Court Square West.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring signage as to the location of libraries.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring signage as to the location of libraries.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to install soundproofing systems near schools where subway and train noise reach disruptive decibel levels.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA to install soundproofing systems near schools where subway and train noise reach disruptive decibel levels.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Department of Education to require that all public school students receive age-differentiated anti-bullying instruction and complete an anti-bullying course focused especially on cyberbullying.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Require that all public school students receive age-differentiated anti-bullying instruction and complete an anti-bullying course focused especially on cyberbullying.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the right of way of pedestrians and bicyclists.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: The right of way of pedestrians and bicyclists.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of vacation leave and employment.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Provision of vacation leave and employment.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to filing semiannual reports on catch basin cleanup and maintenance
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Filing semiannual reports on catch basin cleanup and maintenance

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to borough-specific coordination of snow event response and communication.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Borough-specific coordination of snow event response and communication.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation that would establish a public campaign financing system for campaigns for the office of New York State Comptroller.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Establish a public campaign financing system for campaigns for the office of NYS Comptroller.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to reporting of data by the Independent Budget Office regarding the Earned Sick Time Act.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Reporting of data by the Independent Budget Office regarding the Earned Sick Time Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Department of Justice to fund projects that aid in the protection and location of missing persons with autism.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: US Dept of Justice to fund projects that aid in the protection and location of missing persons with autism.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor and the New York State Department of Transportation to implement the recommendations of the Sheridan-Hunts Point Land Use and Transportation Study.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Transportation
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: DOT to implement the recommendations of the Sheridan-Hunts Point Land Use and Transportation Study.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Assembly and Senate to pass, and the Governor to sign, a State budget which does not bar the City of New York from using State reimbursements for rental subsidy programs for the homeless, and calling on the City of New York and State of New York to work together to create a rental subsidy program for the homeless.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: State budget which does not bar NYC from using State reimbursements for rental subsidy programs for the homeless.
